intro: Pholidota rhombophora, commonly known as the rhomboid-flowered pholidota, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, rhombus-shaped flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a rough, textured surface. While not widely cultivated, it is of interest to botanists due to its morphological features and potential ecological roles.
